meanings.definition: Exteroceptors: sensory receptors that detect stimuli from the external environment
meanings.sent1: The exteroceptors on my skin help me feel the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study exteroceptors to understand how we sense the world around us.
meanings.sent3: The exteroceptors in my eyes must have been on vacation when I mistook a cat for a dog.
meanings.sent4: Her exteroceptors were like antennas, picking up every detail of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The exteroceptors in his fingertips tingled with excitement as he touched the soft petals.

meanings.definition: Exteroceptors: receptors that respond to stimuli outside the body
meanings.sent1: Animals rely on exteroceptors to detect danger in their surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The exteroceptors in the nose help us smell delicious food from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The exteroceptors in my ears must have been napping when I misheard the lyrics of the song.
meanings.sent4: His exteroceptors acted like guardians, alerting him to any approaching threats.
meanings.sent5: The exteroceptors in her skin danced with joy as she felt the cool breeze on a hot day.
